You can always access this information from the FAQ available through the drop down menus in most screens.
Your collection will be stored in the cloud to minimize the storage and memory requirements of your device. We need a unique, verifiable ID to authenticate your access.
Corvus is only accessing your email which is necessary for authentication and your user ID.
You need at least one collection to enter coins. You can set up as many as you need.
Currently, Corvus has only this level to split your overall collection into sub-collections.
Click a collection card to access coins in the collection or long-click to view, edit or delete the collection itself.
The reference collections accessible from the drop down menu on most screens show how we thought of setting up collections to maximize Corvus.
Currently, Corvus doesn\'t automate identification but you can key-word search both your own and reference collections.
You only need to enter a collection name to set up a collection.
You can upload any PNG or JPG picture to represent your collection; best results when cropped square.
We are working on making data input easier including uploading pictures from your computer and batch uploads from excel.
You can enter a unique numeric ID for your collection (1-999). You will be able to sort your collections on this ID as well as on other factors such us last update time and collection value.
Your data is safe. Only you can access your collection and we backup our entire database daily.
The reference collections are there to help you attribute and describe coins.
You can search reference collections in the same way you can search your own collections.
The Corvus reference collections have over 10,000 coins all vf+ or better. We continue to upload them to the app daily.

Yes!! We are working on automating collection sharing. For now you can send us an email letting us know you wish to share and we can add your coins to our reference libraries. We will indicated them as belonging to you or not as per your instructions.
You can add as many coins to your collection as you want. For easier viewing consider setting up multiple collections where you can group similar coins.
Only the personage field is mandatory. We strongly suggest using the attribution field to make it easy to sort your collection
You can upload any PNG or JPG picture to represent your collection; best results when cropped to a rectangle with the coin edges close to the image edge.
The fields you do not fill in will not appear at all in your record to make viewing easier
The RIC number is numeric for sorting purposes. In the RICvar field you can add qualifiers such as a letter (e.g. RIC 197 b) or var or note
If you wish to add Provincial coins, the legend fields can be toggled to the greek alphabet
